content.statement: vascular:pharmacology:pharm-003-dti is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pharmacology that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding vascular:pharmacology:pharm-003-dti helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of vascular:pharmacology:pharm-003-dti include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of vascular:pharmacology:pharm-003-dti.

mechanism.HIT_safety: Does not cross-react with HIT antibodies

argatroban.HIT_dosing: 2 mcg/kg/min (reduce to 0.5 mcg/kg/min in hepatic impairment)
argatroban.caution: Falsely elevates INR - complicates warfarin bridging

bivalirudin.advantages: Short half-life, predictable offset, good for procedures

dabigatran.dosing: 150 mg BID (110 mg BID if CrCl 30-50 or age >75)

monitoring.argatroban: aPTT q4h until stable; goal 1.5-3x baseline
monitoring.bivalirudin: ACT for procedures; no routine monitoring otherwise
monitoring.dabigatran: No routine monitoring; dilute thrombin time or ecarin clotting time if needed

reversal.argatroban: No specific antidote; short half-life allows offset; consider PCC
reversal.bivalirudin: Very short half-life (25 min) - stop infusion; consider PCC
reversal.dabigatran: Idarucizumab (Praxbind) 5g IV - complete reversal within minutes

definition.@value: Anticoagulants that bind directly to thrombin independent of antithrombin, used for HIT and procedural anticoagulation, with varying metabolic pathways determining agent selection.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Select appropriate DTI based on hepatic/renal function
clinical_pearls: Argatroban = HEPATIC metabolism - use in renal failure, avoid in liver failure
Bivalirudin = SHORT half-life (25 min) - ideal for procedures
Argatroban falsely elevates INR - complicates warfarin transition
Idarucizumab (Praxbind) completely reverses dabigatran - available for emergencies
DTIs do NOT cross-react with HIT antibodies - safe in HIT
Dabigatran 80% renal - adjust or avoid in CrCl <30
